text: 375 ml bottle. Bretty nose, grapefruit, lots of horse blanket, very dry. Hazy golden-orange color with lace. Flavor is grapefruit, some cheese, nicely tart with medium acidity, some lactic acid and sharp citrus flavor. Quite authentic, though not up there with the best from Belgium.

Many thansk to fonefan for handing over a big bottle at Himmeriget, shared with Skinnyviking. Next to clear golden body. Dissipating white head, dotted spots on the glass. Berry fruits on the nose, dry. Mixed taste of cheese and tart yeast fruitiness. Rounded mid-tart ending. Pleasing and refreshing. (Copenhagen 10.05.2017).
Bottle - pours orange gold white head - nose and taste of horseblanket, sherry, funk, oak, lemon and earthy acidy funky - medium body

Bottle @ Himmeriget. Hazy golden with tiny off-white head. Aroma is malt, lemon, barnyard, tart and fruit peel. Flavour is malt, fruit, tart, barnyard, fruit peel, little dry, little sweet, citric, little sour and a little dry.
Bottle at Himmeriget. Low but lasting fluffy white head. Hazy yellow body. Sour herbal citrus aroma and flavor with a nice hops bitterness as well. Low carbonation. Long finish.
Bottle at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Sourness, tartness, citric elements and some sweetness.
Bottle @Himmeriget. Hazy golden, small white head. Sour, slightly funky aroma. Lemon and woody notes. Sour, tart flavour. Lemon and wood, peachy and malty notes. Light acidic bite, fluffy mouthfeel.
Bottled. Golden hazy coloured. Dense off white head. Aroma. Sourness, herbs, sourness citrus. Flavour. Sourness, herbs spice la la. Nediu, to full endd sour and citric
Bottle at himmeriget... Copenhagen 2017... Hazy amber.. Thin white lacing... Dry barn yard.. Zezty lemon fruits funk nose.. Tart fruits.. Long barnyard.. Zezty lemon.. Long farmyard
Bottle @ Himmeriget. Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, barnyard, lemon and wood. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 110517

Bottle @ Himmeriget. Pours slightly hazy dark yellow with a offwhite head. Aroma of light sourness, yeast, barnyard, leather, wood, tart green fruit, grapes. Flavor is sour, yeast, barnyard, green apples, grapes. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and acidic finish. 110517

From bottle shared at Ratebeer Best awards and bottle-share. Thanks DJ! Unclear yellow color with off white head. Yeasty aroma, funky, barnyard, grass, floral, citrusy fruity, wood, vinous. Light sweet and moderate acidic taste. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle @ RateBeer Best 2017 Bottle Share. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity sour tart funky citrus aroma. Fruity sour tart woody funky citrus flavor. Has a fruity sour tart citrus funky woody finish.

[1/29/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at the RateBeer award ceremony bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Cloudy yellow. Funk, oak, citrus, leather, fruitiness, sour, juicy, fruit, vinous note. Wonderful.

33.5 cl partagée avec la BXL tasting crew, merci Pierre T.
Dorée sur léger voile, col blanc modéré.
Arôme au nez assez subtil de barrique, funk avec une petite note presque abricot en rétro-nasal. Jai un peu de mal à croire en la complexité de lhistoire de la bière où les levures sauvages contenues dans une barrique de sherry auraient trouvés refuge dans une autre barrique neutre en emmenant leur caractère de sherry.
Palais est sec, grains, citornné un peu de côté cartonné avec un caractère de boisé perdurant et léger funk. Ok correct sans vraiment comprendre le prix vs. résultat.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange gold with medium frothy white head. The aroma is funky, apple skin, oak, barnyard. Medium body, nice funk, strong tartness, apple, oak, lemon, really enjoyed this.
Shared bottle at RateBeer Best. Thanks DJ. Pours a hazy pale gold with a small off-white head. Aroma of citrus, funk, and wood. Taste is lemon, fruit, oak, and funk. Very nice.

Bottle pour at the RateBeer Best 2017 Grand Tasting/Bottle Share. Thanks djd07! Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of musty oak, lemon, tart acidic notes. Tastes of musty funk, lemon, tart acidic notes. Light body with a dry finish.
375ml bottle thanks to dj pours out a golden topped with a white head. Nose is amazing full of funk barrel and a nice fruit. Taste is buggy barrel south funk. Wow.

Draft pour a couple times at the source. The beer is a moderately hazy yellow with a white head of foam. The aroma has juicy, funky notes, some dry, floral aspects as well. A bit of a white wine acidity. Funky and a little herbal, yet finishes with a zippy sort of tartness. Medium body and medium carbonation. Pretty good beer!
On at JK. Pours a hazy orangey golden color. Aromas of lemon and slight vinegar. Taste is balanced acidity. Lacking much depth of flavor.

Hazy yellow orange in color... Aroma of juicy apricots, stone fruits, sherry barrel... flavor is funk, stone fruits, funky bitterness, earthy tones, hay, some peppers, sherry... delicious

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(375ml bottle) cloudy gold, yeast chunks, fine offwhite bubbles. Nose of sherry, forest floor, gueuze funk, lemon zest, horseblanket and aged hops. Complex in every way. Restrained nicely. Reminds of a traditional gueuze with a unique sherry element. Taste of lemon zest, funk, seltzer, aged hops, touch of moss, tastes absolutely delicious. So easy to drink.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2016 On draft at the source. Pours dark gold color. Small hint of sherry, oak. Light mouthfeel. Peach, lemon juice. If you have this beer dont crack it out of the fridge let it come closer to room temperature to help bring out the sherry character. This beer might also benefit from decanting.

Pour from a 375 ml bottle at the Shelton Brothers Festival. Pours a hazy gold color with a small white head that settles into a patchy film and a ring. Notes of sawdust, lemon, vanilla, stone fruits, wheat and dry grains, grass, herbs, and a relatively sharp acidic note throughout. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a tart, funky, musty mouthfeel. Excellent stuff. Id love to track these SPON bottles down and spend some more time with them.
